intro: Psychotria rufipes, commonly known as the red-footed Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dark green, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, red berries that are often used in traditional medicine. The plant contains alkaloids, making it an important species in botanical and pharmacological research.
